introduction: Prior to Laurent Garnier there was Chicago house music and Detroit techno. Both these dance music styles rubbed shoulders with each other on the UK club scene, but it was Garnier who worked his particular brand of musical alchemy, fusing them together. In the process he became one of the first globe-trotting superstar DJs and his club nights from London to Tokyo were legend. Director Gabin Rivoire interviews the likes of Jeff Mills, Carl Cox and The Blessed Madonna in a quest to get to the core of what made Garnier such a musical pioneer.
